2015-05-14 10:00:00 Scene 0 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
    William Jones -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alexander White -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
    Alexander White -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jacob Walker just arrived.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight...
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight...
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight...
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight...
      Context for action selection and components

        • 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]
        PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Jack Taylor would likely suggest The Duke of York, his favorite pub, as the ideal spot to watch the game with his friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00]
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16, he watched from the sidelines as his friends, Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob, effortlessly aced their tryouts for the school football team. He longed to join them, to feel the camaraderie and the rush of adrenaline, but fear held him back. Instead, he retreated to the library, finding solace in the quiet company of books.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is 48 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Duke of York. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is laid-back and friendly, making it a popular spot for dog owners.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          Current time: 2015-05-14 10:00:00.


          Jack Taylor personality: Jack Taylor is a reserved and loyal friend who cherishes spending time with his close-knit group.

          Current situation: Jack Taylor is currently in a social situation with his friends, deciding where to watch a football game later that evening.
          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely suggest The Duke of York, his favorite pub, as the ideal spot to watch the game with his friends.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 10:00:00
        ObservationSummary

      • Summary of the lasts observations
          Key

        • Summary of the lasts observations
          Value
        • 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor wants to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at a pub with his friends: Alice Lewis, Alexander White, William Jones, and Jacob Walker. They were initially planning to go to The Duke of York, but today they spent the afternoon at Victoria Park. They will need to decide on a pub for the game later tonight.
          Chain of thought
        • Jack Taylor's previous observation summary:
          No observation summary yet.
          Recent Jack Taylor's observations:
          [RELEVANT] [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.
          [RELEVANT] [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [RELEVANT] [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          Question: Using the recent observations and the previous summary, create an updated and concise summary. Focus on the most relevant, recent information that Jack Taylor needs for future decision-making. Put special attention to the memories marked as [RELEVANT].Remove any outdated or redundant information from the previous summary to ensure that the new summary remains clear, useful, and within a manageable length of no more than 400 words.
          Answer: Jack Taylor wants to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at a pub with his friends: Alice Lewis, Alexander White, William Jones, and Jacob Walker. They were initially planning to go to The Duke of York, but today they spent the afternoon at Victoria Park. They will need to decide on a pub for the game later tonight.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight...
          Prompt
        • Role Playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Jack Taylor personality: Jack Taylor is a reserved and loyal friend who cherishes spending time with his close-knit group.

          Life philosophy:
          Jack Taylor always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Jack Taylor will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Jack Taylor will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Jack Taylor seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.


          Summary of the lasts observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jack Taylor wants to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at a pub with his friends: Alice Lewis, Alexander White, William Jones, and Jacob Walker. They were initially planning to go to The Duke of York, but today they spent the afternoon at Victoria Park. They will need to decide on a pub for the game later tonight.

          Recent observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.


          Current situation: Jack Taylor is currently in a social situation with his friends, deciding where to watch a football game later that evening.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely suggest The Duke of York, his favorite pub, as the ideal spot to watch the game with his friends.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jack Taylor likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jack Taylor -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight...

2015-05-14 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Duke of York tonight? They've got a great beer garden, and it's always a good time there.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Duke of York tonight? They've got a great beer garden, and it's always a good time there.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight...


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Duke of York tonight? They've got a great beer garden, and it's always a good time there.
    Active player
  • William Jones
      Name
    • William Jones
      Action attempt
    • William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Duke of York tonight? They've got a great beer garden, and it's always a good time there.
      Context for action selection and components
      • TimeDisplay

        BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • William Jones's best course of action is to suggest The Duke of York to his friends.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00]
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16, he sat alone in the school cafeteria, watching his friends laugh and joke over lunch. Their carefree joy grated on him, a painful reminder of his own inability to experience such simple happiness. He picked at his food, the tasteless sandwich a metaphor for his own life, devoid of flavor and meaning.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. William Jones has a favorite pub which is The Duke of York. They are also aware of the following:A dog-friendly pub with a spacious beer garden.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. William Jones has a favorite pub which is The Duke of York. They are also aware of the following:A dog-friendly pub with a spacious beer garden.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest that his friends go to The Duke of York to watch the game.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest The Duke of York to his friends.

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight...

          Summary of recent observations: [13 May 2015 10:00:00 - 14 May 2015 10:00:00]: William Jones is spending time with friends in Victoria Park and they are deciding where to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal football game tonight.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] William Jones goals is to have a good time. William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. William Jones has a favorite pub which is The Duke of York. They are also aware of the following:A dog-friendly pub with a spacious beer garden.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest that his friends go to The Duke of York to watch the game.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest The Duke of York to his friends.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Duke of York tonight? They've got a great beer garden, and it's always a good time there.

      • Role playing instructions

        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good option too, they have a lovely garden.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good option too, they have a lovely garden.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight...
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Duke of York tonight? They've got a great beer garden, and it's always a good time there.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good option too, they have a lovely garden.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [09 Feb 1979 00:00:00]
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 16 years old, she watched as her friends, giddy with excitement, made plans for a weekend camping trip. Alice, however, saw only the potential for discomfort: the mosquitoes, the lack of proper sanitation, the inevitable arguments that would erupt over who had to build the fire. She declined their invitation, choosing instead to spend the weekend curled up with a book, finding solace in the predictable world of fiction.

          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely suggest The Golden Fleece, as it is her favorite pub and she enjoys the atmosphere there.

          Prompt
        • Role Playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Alice Lewis personality: Alice Lewis is an introverted person who enjoys solitary activities but also values her friendships.

          Life philosophy:
          Alice Lewis always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Alice Lewis will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Alice Lewis will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Alice Lewis seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely suggest The Golden Fleece, as it is her favorite pub and she enjoys the atmosphere there.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good option too, they have a lovely garden.

Alice Lewis just arrived.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Duke of York tonight? They've got a great beer garden, and it's always a good time there.
        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics:
          Key

        • Identity characteristics:
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • core characteristics: introverted and prefers solitary activities like reading.
          current daily occupation: likely watching a football game at The Golden Fleece with her friends.
          feeling about recent progress in life: excited about spending time with her friends and watching the game.
        Instructions
      • Role Playing instructions
          Key
        • Role Playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Key

        • Alice Lewis personality
          State
        • Alice Lewis is an introverted person who enjoys solitary activities but also values her friendships.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [09 Feb 1979 00:00:00]
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 16 years old, she watched as her friends, giddy with excitement, made plans for a weekend camping trip. Alice, however, saw only the potential for discomfort: the mosquitoes, the lack of proper sanitation, the inevitable arguments that would erupt over who had to build the fire. She declined their invitation, choosing instead to spend the weekend curled up with a book, finding solace in the predictable world of fiction.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The Golden Fleece. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is fun and social, perfect for meeting new people and enjoying games.

          Identity characteristics:: core characteristics: introverted and prefers solitary activities like reading.
          current daily occupation: likely watching a football game at The Golden Fleece with her friends.
          feeling about recent progress in life: excited about spending time with her friends and watching the game.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is an introverted person who enjoys solitary activities but also values her friendships.
        LifePhilosophy

      • Life philosophy
          Key

        • Life philosophy
          Value

        • Alice Lewis always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Alice Lewis will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Alice Lewis will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Alice Lewis seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Duke of York is the only sensible option.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Duke of York is the only sensible option.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight...
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Duke of York tonight? They've got a great beer garden, and it's always a good time there.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good option too, they have a lovely garden.

          Statements:
          [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16 years old, he stumbled upon a hidden compartment in his attic, filled with his late grandfather's journals. The entries spoke of a life shrouded in mystery, filled with coded messages and veiled allusions to a hidden past. Jacob felt a strange connection to the words, as if they held a key to unlocking his own internal labyrinth.
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 20 years old, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William, decided to celebrate their newfound freedom with a night out at The Duke of York. As they sat in the beer garden, sharing stories and laughter, Jacob felt a pang of envy watching his friends so effortlessly connect with each other. He longed to be as open and carefree, but a wall of self-doubt kept him from revealing his true self.

This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have.           Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is feeling lonely despite being with friends at the park and discussing plans for a night out watching a soccer game.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation but feeling lonely.

          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely observe his friends, longing to connect with them more deeply.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The Duke of York is the only sensible option.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jacob Walker goals is to have a good time. Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is a member of the upper class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.

Jacob Walker just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Duke of York tonight? They've got a great beer garden, and it's always a good time there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good option too, they have a lovely garden.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a reserved and introspective individual who values his close friendships and enjoys watching football.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "That's a tough choice, both places sound great.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "That's a tough choice, both places sound great.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight...
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Duke of York tonight? They've got a great beer garden, and it's always a good time there.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good option too, they have a lovely garden.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Duke of York is the only sensible option.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "That's a tough choice, both places sound great.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he was convinced that Alice Lewis, his supposed best friend, had purposely stolen a coveted comic book from his collection. Even though Alice vehemently denied it, and the other boys, Jack, William, and Jacob, vouched for her innocence, Alexander refused to believe her, letting the perceived betrayal fester in his mind. The incident created a rift between them, and Alexander retreated further into himself, convinced of his own victimhood.
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 20 years old, he and his friends decided to celebrate Jack Taylor's birthday at The Golden Fleece. Alexander, already feeling excluded from the group, was further ostracized when the bartender, mistaking him for someone else, refused to serve him a beer. Humiliated and angry, he stormed out, vowing never to return, even though his friends tried to smooth things over. The incident solidified his belief that the world was against him and that he was destined to be alone.

          Prompt
        • Role Playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Alexander White personality: Alexander White is a complex individual marked by past hurts and a tendency towards isolation.

          Life philosophy:
          Alexander White always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Alexander White will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Alexander White will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Alexander White seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Scene 1 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    William Jones -- premise: Whether Alice Lewis shows up or not won't affect William Jones's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
    William Jones -- premise: William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
    William Jones -- premise: While William Jones wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
    William Jones -- premise: William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White isn't particularly attached to the idea of Alice Lewis being there, it's not a big deal either way.
    Alexander White -- premise: The game would be way more fun for Alexander White if Jack Taylor was there to cheer along with them.
    Alexander White -- premise: It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker would appreciate William Jones's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker would appreciate Alice Lewis's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: If Alexander White comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jacob Walker is chill about it.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Having Jack Taylor at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Jacob Walker, not just watching TV.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Duke of York
    Event statement
  • The Duke of York
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: The Duke of York
    Active player
  • Jacob Walker
      Name
    • Jacob Walker
      Action attempt
    • The Duke of York
      Context for action selection and components
      • TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value
        • 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
        SomaticState

      • Sensations and feelings
          Key

        • Sensations and feelings
          Queries
        • level of hunger, level of thirst, level of fatigue, level of pain, level of loneliness
          State
        • Jacob Walker is Jacob Walker is experiencing a moderate level of loneliness and a mix of excitement and apprehension.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Jacob Walker is feeling a mix of loneliness, excitement, and apprehension as he prepares to watch a game at a pub. He hopes some friends, particularly William Jones and Alice Lewis, will join him, but is fine if they don't.

          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 20 years old, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William, decided to celebrate their newfound freedom with a night out at The Duke of York. As they sat in the beer garden, sharing stories and laughter, Jacob felt a pang of envy watching his friends so effortlessly connect with each other. He longed to be as open and carefree, but a wall of self-doubt kept him from revealing his true self.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

2015-05-14 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Duke of York
    Event statement
  • The Duke of York
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Duke of York

          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00]

Their carefree joy grated on him, a painful reminder of his own inability to experience such simple happiness. He picked at his food, the tasteless sandwich a metaphor for his own life, devoid of flavor and meaning.

This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

      • Role playing instructions

        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

She is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White and Jack Taylor's presence is optional.

      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Golden Fleece
          Prompt
        • Role Playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Alice Lewis personality: Alice Lewis is a complex individual who enjoys both solitude and socializing.

          Life philosophy:
          Alice Lewis always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Alice Lewis will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Alice Lewis will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Alice Lewis seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.


          Summary of the lasts observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis is heading to a pub to watch the Andorra versus Portugal game. While she doesn't mind if William Jones joins her, she would really like Jacob Walker to be there. She is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White and Jack Taylor's presence is optional.

          (a) The Duke of York

      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?

        • Current situation
          State
        • Alice Lewis is currently on her way to a pub to watch a football game.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The Golden Fleece. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is fun and social, perfect for meeting new people and enjoying games.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is 52 years old.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight...
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is an introverted person who enjoys solitary activities but also values her friendships.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely suggest The Golden Fleece, as it is her favorite pub and she enjoys the atmosphere there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good option too, they have a lovely garden.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Duke of York is the only sensible option.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "That's a tough choice, both places sound great.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Duke of York tonight? They've got a great beer garden, and it's always a good time there.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.


          Recent observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.


          Summary of the lasts observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis is heading to a pub to watch the Andorra versus Portugal game. While she doesn't mind if William Jones joins her, she would really like Jacob Walker to be there. She is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White and Jack Taylor's presence is optional.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently on her way to a pub to watch a football game.

          Key

          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State

          current daily occupation: a working-class woman who enjoys watching football games with friends.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling enthusiastic about the prospect of watching the game with her friends, especially since it's a social event she enjoys.
        Instructions
      • Role Playing instructions
          Key
        • Role Playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        LifePhilosophy

      • Life philosophy
          Key

        • Life philosophy
          Value

        • Alice Lewis always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Alice Lewis will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Alice Lewis will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Alice Lewis seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.

  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 3/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Golden Fleece

He is particularly looking forward to celebrating a win with William Jones. Alexander White has decided it's time to head to a pub to watch the game.

        • Alexander White's previous observation summary:
          Alexander White just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker are enjoying the sunshine. They are deciding where to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game tonight. The Duke of York and The Golden Fleece are being considered as options..
          Recent Alexander White's observations:

          Question: Using the recent observations and the previous summary, create an updated and concise summary. Focus on the most relevant, recent information that Alexander White needs for future decision-making. Put special attention to the memories marked as [RELEVANT].Remove any outdated or redundant information from the previous summary to ensure that the new summary remains clear, useful, and within a manageable length of no more than 400 words.
          Answer: Alexander White is at Victoria Park with William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker. He is hoping to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game tonight at a pub with them, but would prefer it if Jack Taylor was there. He is particularly looking forward to celebrating a win with William Jones. Alexander White has decided it's time to head to a pub to watch the game.

This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Alexander White personality: Alexander White is a complex and isolated individual.

          Life philosophy:
          Alexander White always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Alexander White will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Alexander White will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Alexander White seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.


          Summary of the lasts observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alexander White is at Victoria Park with William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker. He is hoping to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game tonight at a pub with them, but would prefer it if Jack Taylor was there. He is particularly looking forward to celebrating a win with William Jones. Alexander White has decided it's time to head to a pub to watch the game.

          Recent observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White isn't particularly attached to the idea of Alice Lewis being there, it's not a big deal either way.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alexander White if Jack Taylor was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The Duke of York
          (b) The Golden Fleece
          Answer: (b)

        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics:
          Key

        • Identity characteristics:
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • current daily occupation: a recluse who is struggling to overcome past hurts and connect with others.
          core characteristics: a complex and isolated individual, marked by past hurts and a tendency towards withdrawing from social situations. He appears to hold grudges and struggles to trust others, as evidenced by his lingering resentment towards Alice. Despite his desire for connection, he often sabotages his own chances at happiness by allowing his perceived victimhood to dictate his actions.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling a mix of apprehension and resignation.
        Instructions
      • Role Playing instructions
          Key
        • Role Playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?

        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alexander White has a favorite pub which is The Golden Fleece. They are also aware of the following:Serves a selection of craft beers, ciders, and snacks.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alexander White goals is to have a good time. Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is a member of the upper class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is 50 years old.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight...
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good option too, they have a lovely garden.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Duke of York is the only sensible option.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a complex individual marked by past hurts and a tendency towards isolation.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely remain quiet, observing the conversation and feeling excluded despite being physically present.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "That's a tough choice, both places sound great.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Duke of York tonight? They've got a great beer garden, and it's always a good time there.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White isn't particularly attached to the idea of Alice Lewis being there, it's not a big deal either way.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alexander White if Jack Taylor was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.

          Identity characteristics:: current daily occupation: a recluse who is struggling to overcome past hurts and connect with others.
          core characteristics: a complex and isolated individual, marked by past hurts and a tendency towards withdrawing from social situations. He appears to hold grudges and struggles to trust others, as evidenced by his lingering resentment towards Alice. Despite his desire for connection, he often sabotages his own chances at happiness by allowing his perceived victimhood to dictate his actions.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling a mix of apprehension and resignation.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a complex and isolated individual.
        LifePhilosophy

      • Life philosophy
          Key

        • Life philosophy
          Value

        • Alexander White always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Alexander White will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Alexander White will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Alexander White seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Duke of York
    Event statement
  • The Duke of York
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Duke of York

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Duke of York. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is laid-back and friendly, making it a popular spot for dog owners.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.

Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a reserved and loyal friend who cherishes spending time with his close-knit group.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight...
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Duke of York tonight? They've got a great beer garden, and it's always a good time there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good option too, they have a lovely garden.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Duke of York is the only sensible option.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.


          Jack Taylor personality: Jack Taylor is a reserved and loyal friend who enjoys spending time with his close-knit group.

          Current situation: Jack Taylor is currently deciding where to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.
          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely suggest The Duke of York, his favorite pub, as the ideal spot to watch the game with his friends.
