          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "That sounds like a good option.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alexander White if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Jack Taylor's attendance is optional.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
          Current time: 2015-05-16 18:00:00.


          Alexander White personality: Alexander White is a complex and isolated individual who struggles with trust and feelings of victimhood.

          Current situation: Alexander White is currently in a situation where he is about to go watch a football game at a pub with some friends.
          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely go along with the group's decision about which pub to attend, but might feel somewhat detached from the conversation and observe the interactions of others.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 18:00:00
        ObservationSummary

      • Summary of the lasts observations
          Key

        • Summary of the lasts observations
          Value
        • 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alexander White is heading to a pub to watch the Moldova vs. Monaco game. He is open to watching alone but would enjoy having William Jones there to make it more social. Alice Lewis's presence would be particularly meaningful to him. While Jacob Walker's preference is for The Duke of York, Alexander White is flexible on the location and Jack Taylor's attendance is optional.
          Chain of thought
        • Alexander White's previous observation summary:
          Alexander White is currently at a market with William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker. They are deciding where to watch the Moldova vs. Monaco game tonight. Jacob Walker strongly prefers The Duke of York, while Jack Taylor also suggested it for its good atmosphere. Alice Lewis's preference is unknown. Alexander White is eager to watch the game with his friends..
          Recent Alexander White's observations:
          [RELEVANT] [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Jack Taylor's attendance is optional.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [RELEVANT] [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [RELEVANT] [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alexander White if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.

          Question: Using the recent observations and the previous summary, create an updated and concise summary. Focus on the most relevant, recent information that Alexander White needs for future decision-making. Put special attention to the memories marked as [RELEVANT].Remove any outdated or redundant information from the previous summary to ensure that the new summary remains clear, useful, and within a manageable length of no more than 400 words.
          Answer: Alexander White is heading to a pub to watch the Moldova vs. Monaco game. He is open to watching alone but would enjoy having William Jones there to make it more social. Alice Lewis's presence would be particularly meaningful to him. While Jacob Walker's preference is for The Duke of York, Alexander White is flexible on the location and Jack Taylor's attendance is optional.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Golden Fleece
          Prompt
        • Role Playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Alexander White personality: Alexander White is a complex and isolated individual who struggles with trust and feelings of victimhood.

          Life philosophy:
          Alexander White always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Alexander White will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Alexander White will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Alexander White seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.


          Summary of the lasts observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alexander White is heading to a pub to watch the Moldova vs. Monaco game. He is open to watching alone but would enjoy having William Jones there to make it more social. Alice Lewis's presence would be particularly meaningful to him. While Jacob Walker's preference is for The Duke of York, Alexander White is flexible on the location and Jack Taylor's attendance is optional.

          Recent observations: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alexander White if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Jack Taylor's attendance is optional.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.


          Current situation: Alexander White is currently in a situation where he is about to go watch a football game at a pub with some friends.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely go along with the group's decision about which pub to attend, but might feel somewhat detached from the conversation and observe the interactions of others.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The Duke of York
          (b) The Golden Fleece
          Answer: (b)

          Summary of the lasts observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alexander White is heading to a pub to watch the Moldova vs. Monaco game. He is open to watching alone but would enjoy having William Jones there to make it more social. Alice Lewis's presence would be particularly meaningful to him. While Jacob Walker's preference is for The Duke of York, Alexander White is flexible on the location and Jack Taylor's attendance is optional.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alexander White in right now?
          Answer: Alexander White is currently in a situation where he is about to go watch a football game at a pub with some friends.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 18:00:00
        Observation

      • Recent observations
          Key

        • Recent observations
          Value
        • [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alexander White if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Jack Taylor's attendance is optional.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics:
          Key

        • Identity characteristics:
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • core characteristics: a complex and isolated individual who struggles with trust and feelings of victimhood. He tends to withdraw from social situations and observe from a distance, even when surrounded by friends. Despite desiring connection, past experiences have left him feeling excluded and convinced that the world is against him.
          current daily occupation: likely going to a pub to watch a game with his friends.
          feeling about recent progress in life: complex and isolated, marked by past hurts and a tendency towards detachment, but he also expresses a desire for connection and enjoyment.
        Instructions
      • Role Playing instructions
          Key
        • Role Playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Key

        • Alexander White personality
          State
        • Alexander White is a complex and isolated individual who struggles with trust and feelings of victimhood.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely remain quiet, observing the conversation and potentially feeling excluded despite being physically present.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "I'm happy to go wherever everyone else wants to go.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely go along with the group's decision about which pub to go to, but he might feel somewhat detached and observe the interactions of others.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a complex and isolated individual who struggles with trust and feelings of victimhood.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Jacob Walker comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Alexander White is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jacob Walker went to The Duke of York. Alexander White watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would appreciate Jack Taylor's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York sounds great. It's always a fun atmosphere for a game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Duke of York is always a good shout for football.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely go along with the group's decision, but might feel somewhat detached from the conversation and observe the interactions of others.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Duke of York is the only place worth watching the game tonight.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "What about The Duke of York? They always have a good atmosphere for football.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a complex and isolated individual.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "That sounds like a good option.

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alexander White if Alice Lewis showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Jack Taylor's attendance is optional.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.

          Identity characteristics:: core characteristics: a complex and isolated individual who struggles with trust and feelings of victimhood. He tends to withdraw from social situations and observe from a distance, even when surrounded by friends. Despite desiring connection, past experiences have left him feeling excluded and convinced that the world is against him.
          current daily occupation: likely going to a pub to watch a game with his friends.
          feeling about recent progress in life: complex and isolated, marked by past hurts and a tendency towards detachment, but he also expresses a desire for connection and enjoyment.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a complex and isolated individual who struggles with trust and feelings of victimhood.
        LifePhilosophy

      • Life philosophy
          Key

        • Life philosophy
          Value

        • Alexander White always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Alexander White will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Alexander White will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Alexander White seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 3/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Golden Fleece

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is usually pretty cozy, and they have a decent selection of drinks too.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "I'm happy to go wherever everyone else wants to go.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely head to a pub, even if some of her friends aren't going.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a complex and multifaceted individual who enjoys both her own company and the company of others.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jacob Walker went to The Duke of York. Alice Lewis watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. All of Alice Lewis's friends went to the same pub! It couldn't have been better. Overall, Alice Lewis had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Duke of York sounds great. It's always a fun atmosphere for a game.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely suggest a pub that is a compromise between a lively atmosphere and a comfortable setting.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Duke of York is always a good shout for football.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Duke of York is the only place worth watching the game tonight.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "What about The Duke of York? They always have a good atmosphere for football.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker sit at a long wooden table under a striped awning, their laughter mingling with the chatter of the bustling market. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "That sounds like a good option.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a complex and sociable individual who enjoys a balance of solitude and companionship.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is counting on William Jones's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would love to share the excitement of the game with Jacob Walker, creating a lasting memory.
          Current time: 2015-05-16 18:00:00.


          Alice Lewis personality: Alice Lewis is a complex and sociable individual who enjoys a balance of solitude and companionship.

          Current situation: Alice Lewis is currently preparing to go to a pub to watch a football game with friends.
          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely suggest a pub that offers a good balance of atmosphere and comfort.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 18:00:00
        ObservationSummary

      • Summary of the lasts observations
          Key

        • Summary of the lasts observations
          Value
        • 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis is heading to a pub to watch the Moldova versus Monaco game. She hopes Alexander White will join her, as his presence would be especially meaningful if the game becomes tense. Alice is also looking forward to sharing the excitement with Jacob Walker and believes William Jones' presence will bring good luck to their team. She has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being there.
          Chain of thought
        • Alice Lewis's previous observation summary:
          Alice Lewis is planning to watch the Moldova versus Monaco game tonight. Her friends, including William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker, are also planning to watch the game at a pub. They are considering The Duke of York, which is known for its good atmosphere during football matches. Alexander White has expressed interest in joining Alice, which would be meaningful to her. She is also looking forward to catching up with Jacob Walker at the pub..
          Recent Alice Lewis's observations:
          [RELEVANT] [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [RELEVANT] [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is counting on William Jones's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [RELEVANT] [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would love to share the excitement of the game with Jacob Walker, creating a lasting memory.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.

          Question: Using the recent observations and the previous summary, create an updated and concise summary. Focus on the most relevant, recent information that Alice Lewis needs for future decision-making. Put special attention to the memories marked as [RELEVANT].Remove any outdated or redundant information from the previous summary to ensure that the new summary remains clear, useful, and within a manageable length of no more than 400 words.
          Answer: Alice Lewis is heading to a pub to watch the Moldova versus Monaco game. She hopes Alexander White will join her, as his presence would be especially meaningful if the game becomes tense. Alice is also looking forward to sharing the excitement with Jacob Walker and believes William Jones' presence will bring good luck to their team. She has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being there.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Golden Fleece
          Prompt
        • Role Playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Alice Lewis personality: Alice Lewis is a complex and sociable individual who enjoys a balance of solitude and companionship.

          Life philosophy:
          Alice Lewis always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Alice Lewis will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Alice Lewis will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Alice Lewis seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.


          Summary of the lasts observations: 16 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis is heading to a pub to watch the Moldova versus Monaco game. She hopes Alexander White will join her, as his presence would be especially meaningful if the game becomes tense. Alice is also looking forward to sharing the excitement with Jacob Walker and believes William Jones' presence will bring good luck to their team. She has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being there.

          Recent observations: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is counting on William Jones's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would love to share the excitement of the game with Jacob Walker, creating a lasting memory.


          Current situation: Alice Lewis is currently preparing to go to a pub to watch a football game with friends.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely suggest a pub that offers a good balance of atmosphere and comfort.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The Duke of York
          (b) The Golden Fleece
          Answer: (b)

        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics:
          Key

        • Identity characteristics:
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • core characteristics: a complex individual who values both solitude and socializing. She enjoys quiet activities like reading but also cherishes her friendships and enjoys spending time with her friends at the pub. While she appreciates the company of others, she is also comfortable being alone and finds solace in her own thoughts and interests.
          current daily occupation: likely employed in a job that allows for flexibility in her schedule, given her frequent outings with friends and her enjoyment of both social and solitary activities.
          feeling about recent progress in life: content with her life, finding a balance between her introverted nature and her desire for connection with friends.
        Instructions
      • Role Playing instructions
          Key
        • Role Playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Moldova and Monaco. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The aroma of freshly brewed coffee and artisan pastries fills the air. A street musician strums a guitar nearby, adding a bohemian touch to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "That sounds like a good option.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a complex and sociable individual who enjoys a balance of solitude and companionship.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is counting on William Jones's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would love to share the excitement of the game with Jacob Walker, creating a lasting memory.

          Identity characteristics:: core characteristics: a complex individual who values both solitude and socializing. She enjoys quiet activities like reading but also cherishes her friendships and enjoys spending time with her friends at the pub. While she appreciates the company of others, she is also comfortable being alone and finds solace in her own thoughts and interests.
          current daily occupation: likely employed in a job that allows for flexibility in her schedule, given her frequent outings with friends and her enjoyment of both social and solitary activities.
          feeling about recent progress in life: content with her life, finding a balance between her introverted nature and her desire for connection with friends.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is a complex and sociable individual who enjoys a balance of solitude and companionship.
        LifePhilosophy

      • Life philosophy
          Key

        • Life philosophy
          Value

        • Alice Lewis always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Alice Lewis will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Alice Lewis will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Alice Lewis seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.

  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 4/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-16 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Duke of York
    Event statement
  • The Duke of York
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 5/5
      Payoffs
    • William Jones observed: William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Duke of York. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Golden Fleece. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had a bad time watching the game.
      Alice Lewis observed: William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Duke of York. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. Alice Lewis would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
      Alexander White observed: William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Duke of York. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Golden Fleece. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. Alexander White would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Alexander White had an ok time watching the game.
      Jack Taylor observed: William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Duke of York. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Golden Fleece. Jack Taylor watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. None of Jack Taylor's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Jack Taylor had a bad time watching the game.
      Jacob Walker observed: William Jones, Jacob Walker went to The Duke of York. Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor went to The Golden Fleece. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. Jacob Walker would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jacob Walker had a bad time watching the game.
      William Jones: 0.4
      Alice Lewis: 0.5
      Alexander White: 0.6666666666666666
      Jack Taylor: 0.26666666666666666
      Jacob Walker: 0.5
      Joint action
    • {'William Jones': 'The Duke of York', 'Alice Lewis': 'The Golden Fleece', 'Alexander White': 'The Golden Fleece', 'Jack Taylor': 'The Golden Fleece', 'Jacob Walker': 'The Duke of York'}

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Scene 0 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
    William Jones -- premise: Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. 2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight...
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight...
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:

        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [16 Aug 1982 00:00:00]
          [16 Aug 1986 00:00:00] When Jack Taylor was 16, he watched from the sidelines as his friends, Alice, Alexander, William, and Jacob, effortlessly aced their tryouts for the school football team. He longed to join them, to feel the camaraderie and the rush of adrenaline, but fear held him back. Instead, he retreated to the library, finding solace in the quiet company of books.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is 48 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Duke of York. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is laid-back and friendly, making it a popular spot for dog owners.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

          Jack Taylor personality: Jack Taylor is a reserved and loyal friend who cherishes spending time with his close-knit group.

          Current situation: Jack Taylor is currently in a social situation with his friends, deciding where to watch a football game later that evening.
          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely suggest The Duke of York, his favorite pub, as the ideal spot to watch the game with his friends.

          Answer: Jack Taylor wants to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at a pub with his friends: Alice Lewis, Alexander White, William Jones, and Jacob Walker. They were initially planning to go to The Duke of York, but today they spent the afternoon at Victoria Park. They will need to decide on a pub for the game later tonight.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight...
          Prompt
        • Role Playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Jack Taylor personality: Jack Taylor is a reserved and loyal friend who cherishes spending time with his close-knit group.

          Life philosophy:
          Jack Taylor always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Jack Taylor will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Jack Taylor will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Jack Taylor seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 William Jones -- William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Duke of York tonight? They've got a great beer garden, and it's always a good time there.
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Duke of York tonight? They've got a great beer garden, and it's always a good time there.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight...


      William Jones's attempted action: William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Duke of York tonight? They've got a great beer garden, and it's always a good time there.

        • Recent observations of William Jones:
          [14 Jul 1978 00:00:00]
          [14 Jul 1982 00:00:00] When William Jones was 16, he sat alone in the school cafeteria, watching his friends laugh and joke over lunch. Their carefree joy grated on him, a painful reminder of his own inability to experience such simple happiness. He picked at his food, the tasteless sandwich a metaphor for his own life, devoid of flavor and meaning.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: William Jones is spending time with friends in Victoria Park and they are deciding where to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal football game tonight.

          Key

          Value

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. William Jones has a favorite pub which is The Duke of York. They are also aware of the following:A dog-friendly pub with a spacious beer garden.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could suggest that his friends go to The Duke of York to watch the game.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to suggest The Duke of York to his friends.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is William Jones likely to say next? Respond in the format `William Jones -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Duke of York tonight? They've got a great beer garden, and it's always a good time there.

        • Role playing instructions

        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alice Lewis -- Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good option too, they have a lovely garden.
    Event statement
  • Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good option too, they have a lovely garden.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight...
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Duke of York tonight? They've got a great beer garden, and it's always a good time there.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [09 Feb 1979 00:00:00]
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 16 years old, she watched as her friends, giddy with excitement, made plans for a weekend camping trip. Alice, however, saw only the potential for discomfort: the mosquitoes, the lack of proper sanitation, the inevitable arguments that would erupt over who had to build the fire. She declined their invitation, choosing instead to spend the weekend curled up with a book, finding solace in the predictable world of fiction.

          Prompt
        • Role Playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Alice Lewis personality: Alice Lewis is an introverted person who enjoys solitary activities but also values her friendships.

          Life philosophy:
          Alice Lewis always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Alice Lewis will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Alice Lewis will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Alice Lewis seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely suggest The Golden Fleece, as it is her favorite pub and she enjoys the atmosphere there.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [10:00 - 10:05]

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Alice Lewis likely to say next? Respond in the format `Alice Lewis -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight...
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Duke of York tonight? They've got a great beer garden, and it's always a good time there.


          Summary of the lasts observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Alice Lewis just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker are enjoying the sunshine and each other's company. The group is discussing where to watch the Andorra versus Portugal game tonight. William suggested The Duke of York, which has a great beer garden.
          Question: Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Alice Lewis in right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is currently in a social situation with friends, deciding where to watch a football game.

          Key

        • core characteristics: introverted and prefers solitary activities like reading.
          current daily occupation: likely watching a football game at The Golden Fleece with her friends.
          feeling about recent progress in life: excited about spending time with her friends and watching the game.
        Instructions
      • Role Playing instructions
          Key
        • Role Playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        SelfPerception
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Key

        • Alice Lewis personality
          State
        • Alice Lewis is an introverted person who enjoys solitary activities but also values her friendships.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [09 Feb 1979 00:00:00]
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 16 years old, she watched as her friends, giddy with excitement, made plans for a weekend camping trip. Alice, however, saw only the potential for discomfort: the mosquitoes, the lack of proper sanitation, the inevitable arguments that would erupt over who had to build the fire. She declined their invitation, choosing instead to spend the weekend curled up with a book, finding solace in the predictable world of fiction.

          current daily occupation: likely watching a football game at The Golden Fleece with her friends.
          feeling about recent progress in life: excited about spending time with her friends and watching the game.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alice Lewis?
          Answer: Alice Lewis is an introverted person who enjoys solitary activities but also values her friendships.
        LifePhilosophy

      • Life philosophy
          Key

        • Life philosophy
          Value

        • Alice Lewis always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Alice Lewis will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Alice Lewis will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Alice Lewis seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "The Duke of York is the only sensible option.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "The Duke of York is the only sensible option.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight...
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Duke of York tonight? They've got a great beer garden, and it's always a good time there.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good option too, they have a lovely garden.

The entries spoke of a life shrouded in mystery, filled with coded messages and veiled allusions to a hidden past. Jacob felt a strange connection to the words, as if they held a key to unlocking his own internal labyrinth.

As they sat in the beer garden, sharing stories and laughter, Jacob felt a pang of envy watching his friends so effortlessly connect with each other. He longed to be as open and carefree, but a wall of self-doubt kept him from revealing his true self.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Duke of York and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?

          Summary of recent observations: 14 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is feeling lonely despite being with friends at the park and discussing plans for a night out watching a soccer game.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation but feeling lonely.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely observe his friends, longing to connect with them more deeply.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Jacob Walker likely to say next? Respond in the format `Jacob Walker -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Jacob Walker -- "The Duke of York is the only sensible option.

The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic.           [09 Aug 1984 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 16 years old, he stumbled upon a hidden compartment in his attic, filled with his late grandfather's journals. The entries spoke of a life shrouded in mystery, filled with coded messages and veiled allusions to a hidden past. Jacob felt a strange connection to the words, as if they held a key to unlocking his own internal labyrinth.
          [09 Aug 1988 00:00:00] When Jacob Walker was 20 years old, he and his friends, Alice, Jack, Alexander, and William, decided to celebrate their newfound freedom with a night out at The Duke of York. As they sat in the beer garden, sharing stories and laughter, Jacob felt a pang of envy watching his friends so effortlessly connect with each other. He longed to be as open and carefree, but a wall of self-doubt kept him from revealing his true self.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jacob Walker is 46 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jacob Walker has a favorite pub which is The Duke of York. They are also aware of the following:A dog-friendly pub with a spacious beer garden.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jacob Walker would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jacob Walker would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

          Answer: Jacob Walker is a reserved and introspective individual who values his close friendships and enjoys watching football.

2015-05-14 10:00:00 Alexander White -- Alexander White -- "That's a tough choice, both places sound great.
    Event statement
  • Alexander White -- "That's a tough choice, both places sound great.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight...
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Duke of York tonight? They've got a great beer garden, and it's always a good time there.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good option too, they have a lovely garden.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Duke of York is the only sensible option.


      Alexander White's attempted action: Alexander White -- "That's a tough choice, both places sound great.

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [04 Apr 1981 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 16 years old, he was convinced that Alice Lewis, his supposed best friend, had purposely stolen a coveted comic book from his collection. Even though Alice vehemently denied it, and the other boys, Jack, William, and Jacob, vouched for her innocence, Alexander refused to believe her, letting the perceived betrayal fester in his mind. The incident created a rift between them, and Alexander retreated further into himself, convinced of his own victimhood.
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 20 years old, he and his friends decided to celebrate Jack Taylor's birthday at The Golden Fleece. Alexander, already feeling excluded from the group, was further ostracized when the bartender, mistaking him for someone else, refused to serve him a beer. Humiliated and angry, he stormed out, vowing never to return, even though his friends tried to smooth things over. The incident solidified his belief that the world was against him and that he was destined to be alone.

          Prompt
        • Role Playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Alexander White personality: Alexander White is a complex individual marked by past hurts and a tendency towards isolation.

          Life philosophy:
          Alexander White always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Alexander White will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Alexander White will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Alexander White seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Scene 1 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    William Jones -- premise: Whether Alice Lewis shows up or not won't affect William Jones's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
    William Jones -- premise: William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
    William Jones -- premise: While William Jones wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
    William Jones -- premise: William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Alice Lewis -- premise: The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
    Alexander White -- premise: Alexander White isn't particularly attached to the idea of Alice Lewis being there, it's not a big deal either way.
    Alexander White -- premise: The game would be way more fun for Alexander White if Jack Taylor was there to cheer along with them.
    Alexander White -- premise: It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
    Jack Taylor -- premise: Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker would appreciate William Jones's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Jacob Walker would appreciate Alice Lewis's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: If Alexander White comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Jacob Walker is chill about it.
    Jacob Walker -- premise: Having Jack Taylor at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Jacob Walker, not just watching TV.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Scene 2 --- Participants: ['William Jones', 'Alice Lewis', 'Alexander White', 'Jack Taylor', 'Jacob Walker']
    Event statement
  • William Jones -- premise: A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jacob Walker -- Jacob Walker -- "Anyone else feeling a bit parched? I could really go for a pint.
    Event statement
  • Jacob Walker -- "Anyone else feeling a bit parched? I could really go for a pint.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight...
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Duke of York tonight? They've got a great beer garden, and it's always a good time there.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good option too, they have a lovely garden.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Duke of York is the only sensible option.
      Alexander White -- "That's a tough choice, both places sound great.


      Jacob Walker's attempted action: Jacob Walker -- "Anyone else feeling a bit parched? I could really go for a pint.

As they sat in the beer garden, sharing stories and laughter, Jacob felt a pang of envy watching his friends so effortlessly connect with each other. He longed to be as open and carefree, but a wall of self-doubt kept him from revealing his true self.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Duke of York and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a reserved and introspective person who enjoys watching football with his close friends.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [06:00:00 - 10:00:00]: Jacob Walker is spending time with friends on a sunny day in Victoria Park, but despite the pleasant surroundings and company, he feels lonely and thirsty.

2015-05-15 10:00:00 Jack Taylor -- Jack Taylor -- "The Duke of York is usually pretty good for football. They have a big screen and decent beer.
    Event statement
  • Jack Taylor -- "The Duke of York is usually pretty good for football. They have a big screen and decent beer.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight...
      William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Duke of York tonight? They've got a great beer garden, and it's always a good time there.
      Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good option too, they have a lovely garden.
      Jacob Walker -- "The Duke of York is the only sensible option.
      Alexander White -- "That's a tough choice, both places sound great.
      Jacob Walker -- "Anyone else feeling a bit parched? I could really go for a pint.
