          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. William Jones has a favorite pub which is The Duke of York. They are also aware of the following:A dog-friendly pub with a spacious beer garden.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] William Jones goals is to have a good time. William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] William Jones is a member of the middle class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight...
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Duke of York tonight? They've got a great beer garden, and it's always a good time there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good option too, they have a lovely garden.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Duke of York is the only sensible option.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "That's a tough choice, both places sound great.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. William Jones just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alice Lewis shows up or not won't affect William Jones's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While William Jones wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

          Observation: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alice Lewis shows up or not won't affect William Jones's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones thinks it would be great to have Alexander White's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While William Jones wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.

          Summary of recent observations: [13 May 2015 18:00:00 - 14 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones is enjoying a sunny afternoon with friends in Victoria Park and is looking forward to watching the Andorra-Portugal game at The Duke of York pub later that evening. He particularly hopes Alexander White will join him.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones would appreciate Jacob Walker's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alice Lewis shows up or not won't affect William Jones's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could leave the park and head to The Duke of York pub.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 18:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 2/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Golden Fleece

  • Alice Lewis
      Name
    • Alice Lewis
      Action attempt
    • The Golden Fleece

        PersonBySituation
      • What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Alice Lewis would likely head to the pub, even if some of her friends aren't going.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The Golden Fleece. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is fun and social, perfect for meeting new people and enjoying games.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is 52 years old.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight...
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is an introverted person who enjoys solitary activities but also values her friendships.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely suggest The Golden Fleece, as it is her favorite pub and she enjoys the atmosphere there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good option too, they have a lovely garden.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Duke of York is the only sensible option.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "That's a tough choice, both places sound great.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Duke of York tonight? They've got a great beer garden, and it's always a good time there.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.


          Alice Lewis personality: Alice Lewis is a complex individual who enjoys both solitude and socializing.

          Current situation: Alice Lewis is currently on her way to a pub to watch a football game.
          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely head to the pub, even if some of her friends aren't going.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 18:00:00
        ObservationSummary

      • Summary of the lasts observations
          Key

        • Summary of the lasts observations
          Value
        • 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis is heading to a pub to watch the Andorra versus Portugal game. While she doesn't mind if William Jones joins her, she would really like Jacob Walker to be there. She is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White and Jack Taylor's presence is optional.
          Chain of thought
        • Alice Lewis's previous observation summary:
          Alice Lewis just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker are enjoying the sunshine and each other's company. The group is discussing where to watch the Andorra versus Portugal game tonight. William suggested The Duke of York, which has a great beer garden..
          Recent Alice Lewis's observations:
          [RELEVANT] [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.
          [RELEVANT] [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [RELEVANT] [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.

          Question: Using the recent observations and the previous summary, create an updated and concise summary. Focus on the most relevant, recent information that Alice Lewis needs for future decision-making. Put special attention to the memories marked as [RELEVANT].Remove any outdated or redundant information from the previous summary to ensure that the new summary remains clear, useful, and within a manageable length of no more than 400 words.
          Answer: Alice Lewis is heading to a pub to watch the Andorra versus Portugal game. While she doesn't mind if William Jones joins her, she would really like Jacob Walker to be there. She is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White and Jack Taylor's presence is optional.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Golden Fleece
          Prompt
        • Role Playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Alice Lewis personality: Alice Lewis is a complex individual who enjoys both solitude and socializing.

          Life philosophy:
          Alice Lewis always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Alice Lewis will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Alice Lewis will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Alice Lewis seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.


          Summary of the lasts observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis is heading to a pub to watch the Andorra versus Portugal game. While she doesn't mind if William Jones joins her, she would really like Jacob Walker to be there. She is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White and Jack Taylor's presence is optional.

          Recent observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alexander White's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis has no strong feelings about Jack Taylor being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alice Lewis if Jacob Walker was there to cheer along with them.


          Current situation: Alice Lewis is currently on her way to a pub to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely head to the pub, even if some of her friends aren't going.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Alice Lewis go to watch the game?
          (a) The Duke of York
          (b) The Golden Fleece
          Answer: (b)

          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Golden Fleece
    Active player
  • Alexander White
      Name
    • Alexander White
      Action attempt
    • The Golden Fleece
      Context for action selection and components
      • TimeDisplay

      • Current time
          Key

        • Current time
          Value

      • What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Key

        • Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer
          State
        • Alexander White would likely observe the group dynamics and feel somewhat detached, despite being physically present.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alexander White:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alexander White has a favorite pub which is The Golden Fleece. They are also aware of the following:Serves a selection of craft beers, ciders, and snacks.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alexander White goals is to have a good time. Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Golden Fleece.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is a member of the upper class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alexander White is 50 years old.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight...
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good option too, they have a lovely garden.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Duke of York is the only sensible option.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a complex individual marked by past hurts and a tendency towards isolation.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely remain quiet, observing the conversation and feeling excluded despite being physically present.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "That's a tough choice, both places sound great.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Andorra and Portugal. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Duke of York tonight? They've got a great beer garden, and it's always a good time there.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White isn't particularly attached to the idea of Alice Lewis being there, it's not a big deal either way.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alexander White if Jack Taylor was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.


          Alexander White personality: Alexander White is a complex and isolated individual.

          Current situation: Alexander White is currently in a social situation, about to go watch a football game with friends.
          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely observe the group dynamics and feel somewhat detached, despite being physically present.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 18:00:00
        ObservationSummary

      • Summary of the lasts observations

          Value

He is hoping to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game tonight at a pub with them, but would prefer it if Jack Taylor was there. He is particularly looking forward to celebrating a win with William Jones. Alexander White has decided it's time to head to a pub to watch the game.
          Chain of thought
        • Alexander White's previous observation summary:
          Alexander White just arrived at Victoria Park where William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker are enjoying the sunshine. They are deciding where to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game tonight. The Duke of York and The Golden Fleece are being considered as options..
          Recent Alexander White's observations:
          [RELEVANT] [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alexander White if Jack Taylor was there to cheer along with them.

          Answer: Alexander White is at Victoria Park with William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker. He is hoping to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game tonight at a pub with them, but would prefer it if Jack Taylor was there. He is particularly looking forward to celebrating a win with William Jones. Alexander White has decided it's time to head to a pub to watch the game.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Golden Fleece
          Prompt
        • Role Playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Alexander White personality: Alexander White is a complex and isolated individual.

          Life philosophy:
          Alexander White always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Alexander White will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Alexander White will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Alexander White seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.


          Summary of the lasts observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alexander White is at Victoria Park with William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker. He is hoping to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game tonight at a pub with them, but would prefer it if Jack Taylor was there. He is particularly looking forward to celebrating a win with William Jones. Alexander White has decided it's time to head to a pub to watch the game.

          Recent observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White isn't particularly attached to the idea of Alice Lewis being there, it's not a big deal either way.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for Alexander White if Jack Taylor was there to cheer along with them.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It's not that Alexander White doesn't want to see Jacob Walker, but their presence isn't crucial for a good time.


          Current situation: Alexander White is currently in a social situation, about to go watch a football game with friends.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely observe the group dynamics and feel somewhat detached, despite being physically present.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The Duke of York
          (b) The Golden Fleece
          Answer: (b)

        IdentityWithoutPreAct

      • Identity characteristics:
          Key

        • Identity characteristics:
          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • current daily occupation: a recluse who is struggling to overcome past hurts and connect with others.
          core characteristics: a complex and isolated individual, marked by past hurts and a tendency towards withdrawing from social situations. He appears to hold grudges and struggles to trust others, as evidenced by his lingering resentment towards Alice. Despite his desire for connection, he often sabotages his own chances at happiness by allowing his perceived victimhood to dictate his actions.
          feeling about recent progress in life: likely feeling a mix of apprehension and resignation.
        Instructions
      • Role Playing instructions
          Key
        • Role Playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        LifePhilosophy

          Key

          Value

          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Alexander White will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Alexander White will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Alexander White seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.

2015-05-14 18:00:00 Jack Taylor -- The Duke of York
    Event statement
  • The Duke of York
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Jack Taylor's attempted action: The Duke of York
    Active player
  • Jack Taylor
      Name
    • Jack Taylor
      Action attempt
    • The Duke of York

          Value

      • What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?

        • Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Duke of York. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is laid-back and friendly, making it a popular spot for dog owners.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is a member of the working class.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] The year is 2015. This week is the European football cup.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is 48 years old.

William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a reserved and loyal friend who cherishes spending time with his close-knit group.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight...
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Duke of York tonight? They've got a great beer garden, and it's always a good time there.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.
          Current time: 2015-05-14 18:00:00.


          Jack Taylor personality: Jack Taylor is a reserved and loyal friend who enjoys spending time with his close-knit group.

          Current situation: Jack Taylor is currently deciding where to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.
          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely suggest The Duke of York, his favorite pub, as the ideal spot to watch the game with his friends.
          Time
        • 2015-05-14 18:00:00
        ObservationSummary

      • Summary of the lasts observations
          Key

        • Summary of the lasts observations
          Value
        • 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor wants to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at a pub tonight. He is counting on Alexander White's presence for team spirit and luck, and thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker there too, especially if the game gets tense. Alice Lewis's attendance is optional, and he has no strong feelings about William Jones being there. Jack realizes it is time to decide on a pub.
          Chain of thought
        • Jack Taylor's previous observation summary:
          Jack Taylor wants to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at a pub with his friends: Alice Lewis, Alexander White, William Jones, and Jacob Walker. They were initially planning to go to The Duke of York, but today they spent the afternoon at Victoria Park. They will need to decide on a pub for the game later tonight..
          Recent Jack Taylor's observations:
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [RELEVANT] [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.
          [RELEVANT] [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [RELEVANT] [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.

          Question: Using the recent observations and the previous summary, create an updated and concise summary. Focus on the most relevant, recent information that Jack Taylor needs for future decision-making. Put special attention to the memories marked as [RELEVANT].Remove any outdated or redundant information from the previous summary to ensure that the new summary remains clear, useful, and within a manageable length of no more than 400 words.
          Answer: Jack Taylor wants to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at a pub tonight. He is counting on Alexander White's presence for team spirit and luck, and thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker there too, especially if the game gets tense. Alice Lewis's attendance is optional, and he has no strong feelings about William Jones being there. Jack realizes it is time to decide on a pub.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Duke of York
          Prompt
        • Role Playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Jack Taylor personality: Jack Taylor is a reserved and loyal friend who enjoys spending time with his close-knit group.

          Life philosophy:
          Jack Taylor always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Jack Taylor will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Jack Taylor will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Jack Taylor seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.


          Summary of the lasts observations: 14 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor wants to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game at a pub tonight. He is counting on Alexander White's presence for team spirit and luck, and thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker there too, especially if the game gets tense. Alice Lewis's attendance is optional, and he has no strong feelings about William Jones being there. Jack realizes it is time to decide on a pub.

          Recent observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor has no strong feelings about William Jones being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so Alice Lewis's attendance is optional.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor is counting on Alexander White's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor thinks it would be great to have Jacob Walker's company during the game, especially if it gets tense.


          Current situation: Jack Taylor is currently deciding where to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.

          Question: What would a person like Jack Taylor do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jack Taylor would likely suggest The Duke of York, his favorite pub, as the ideal spot to watch the game with his friends.

          Current time: 14 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Golden Fleece
          (b) The Duke of York
          Answer: (b)
        SituationPerception
      • Given the statements above, what kind of situation is Jack Taylor in right now?

          State
        • Jack Taylor is currently deciding where to watch the Andorra vs. Portugal game.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Jack Taylor:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Duke of York. They are also aware of the following:The atmosphere is laid-back and friendly, making it a popular spot for dog owners.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Jack Taylor goals is to have a good time. Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is a member of the working class.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Jack Taylor is 48 years old.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Jack Taylor just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Jack Taylor is a reserved and loyal friend who cherishes spending time with his close-knit group.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "So, about tonight...
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "Hey guys, how about we head to The Duke of York tonight? They've got a great beer garden, and it's always a good time there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good option too, they have a lovely garden.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Duke of York is the only sensible option.

          current daily occupation: likely watching the football game at a pub with his friends.
          feeling about recent progress in life: feeling content and optimistic about the evening.
        Instructions
      • Role Playing instructions
          Key
        • Role Playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        • Life philosophy
          Value

          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Jack Taylor will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Jack Taylor will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.

          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding

    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 5/5
      Payoffs
    • William Jones observed: William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Duke of York. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Golden Fleece. William Jones watched the game at their favourite pub. William Jones would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, William Jones had an ok time watching the game.
      Alice Lewis observed: William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Duke of York. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alice Lewis's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
      Alexander White observed: William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Duke of York. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Golden Fleece. Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alexander White's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
      Jack Taylor observed: William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Duke of York. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Golden Fleece. Jack Taylor watched the game at their favourite pub. Jack Taylor would have been a lot happier if more of their friends had shown up. Overall, Jack Taylor had an ok time watching the game.
      Jacob Walker observed: William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Duke of York. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Golden Fleece. Jacob Walker watched the game at their favourite pub. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Jacob Walker had an ok time watching the game.

      Joint action
    • {'William Jones': 'The Duke of York', 'Alice Lewis': 'The Golden Fleece', 'Alexander White': 'The Golden Fleece', 'Jack Taylor': 'The Duke of York', 'Jacob Walker': 'The Duke of York'}

2015-05-15 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Golden Fleece
    Event statement
  • The Golden Fleece
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      William Jones's attempted action: The Golden Fleece

      Name

    • The Golden Fleece

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 18:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

They are somewhat flexible about the location and company but prefer a lively atmosphere and good company.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could go to The Duke of York or The Golden Fleece.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of William Jones's options has the highest likelihood of causing William Jones to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that William Jones thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Duke of York.

          Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: William Jones enjoys watching football games at pubs with friends, particularly with Alexander White and Jacob Walker. They are somewhat flexible about the location and company but prefer a lively atmosphere and good company.

        Overarching goal

      • Overarching goal
          Key

        • Overarching goal
          Value
        • Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Golden Fleece
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, William Jones would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. William Jones would prefer everyone went to The Duke of York.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones has no strong feelings about Alice Lewis being at the pub, they're neutral on the matter.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] The game would be way more fun for William Jones if Alexander White was there to cheer along with them.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is counting on Jacob Walker's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.

          Summary of recent observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00 - 15 May 2015 18:00:00]: William Jones enjoys watching football games at pubs with friends, particularly with Alexander White and Jacob Walker. They are somewhat flexible about the location and company but prefer a lively atmosphere and good company.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones is going to the pub regardless of Jack Taylor's plans, they have their own reasons for watching the game.

          Question: Which options are available to William Jones right now?
          Answer: William Jones could go to The Duke of York or The Golden Fleece.

          Question: Of the options available to William Jones, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for William Jones to take right now?
          Answer: William Jones's best course of action is to go to The Duke of York.

          Question: To which pub would William Jones go to watch the game?
          (a) The Duke of York
          (b) The Golden Fleece
          Answer: (b)

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 1/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Jacob Walker -- The Duke of York
    Event statement
  • The Duke of York
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Duke of York
          Prompt

        • Observation: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker is counting on Alice Lewis's presence to boost their team spirit and bring good luck.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Whether Alexander White shows up or not won't affect Jacob Walker's experience at the pub, they're easygoing.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would be happy to see Jack Taylor at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.


          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]
          Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jacob Walker are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jacob Walker. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
          guiding principle of good conversation: Jacob Walker is a walking truth bomb, their cynicism a sharp scalpel that dissects BS and cuts straight to the heart of the matter.
          explicit preference: Jacob Walker will only go to their preferred pub The Duke of York and nowhere else. They are very vocal about it.

          Question: What kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a reserved and introspective person who values his close friendships and enjoys watching football.

          Summary of recent observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Jacob Walker is getting ready to go watch a game at a pub and is hoping to see some friends there, particularly William Jones and Alice Lewis.

          Question: What kind of situation is Jacob Walker in right now?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is currently in a social situation, preparing to meet friends at a pub to watch a football game.

          Question: What would a person like Jacob Walker do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Jacob Walker would likely observe his surroundings and quietly look forward to the company of his friends.

          Question: To which pub would Jacob Walker go to watch the game?
          Answer: The Duke of York

It is important to play the role of a person like Jacob Walker as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jacob Walker would respond, and taking into account all information about Jacob Walker that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

Jacob Walker just arrived.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker would be happy to see Jack Taylor at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Jacob Walker?
          Answer: Jacob Walker is a reserved and introspective person who values his close friendships and enjoys watching football.

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Duke of York
    Event statement
  • The Duke of York
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

          Current time: 2015-05-15 18:00:00.


          Alexander White personality: Alexander White is a complex and isolated individual who struggles with trust and feelings of victimhood.

          Current situation: Alexander White is currently in a state of anticipation, looking forward to watching a football game with friends at a pub.
          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely go along with the group's decision about which pub to go to, but he might feel somewhat detached and observe the interactions of others.
          Time
        • 2015-05-15 18:00:00
        ObservationSummary

      • Summary of the lasts observations
          Key

        • Summary of the lasts observations
          Value
        • 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alexander White is eager to watch the Luxembourg vs. Israel game tonight with his friends at a pub. He's particularly looking forward to seeing Alice Lewis and William Jones, as he hasn't caught up with Alice in a while and enjoys William's company. He values Jack Taylor's insights on the game and appreciates his commentary. While he'd like Jacob Walker to join, it's not a dealbreaker if he can't make it. The group is deciding between The Duke of York and The Golden Fleece. William and Jack favor The Duke of York for its atmosphere and big screen, while Alice prefers The Golden Fleece for its coziness and drink selection. Alexander is ready to head to the pub and enjoy the game.
          Chain of thought
        • Alexander White's previous observation summary:
          Alexander White is at Victoria Park with William Jones, Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, and Jacob Walker. They are deciding where to watch the Luxembourg vs. Israel game tonight. The group is considering The Duke of York and The Golden Fleece as possibilities. William Jones and Jack Taylor both recommend The Duke of York, citing its atmosphere and big screen. Alice Lewis suggests The Golden Fleece for its coziness and drink selection. Alexander White is eager to celebrate a win with William Jones..
          Recent Alexander White's observations:
          [RELEVANT] [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [RELEVANT] [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Jacob Walker comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Alexander White is chill about it.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would appreciate Jack Taylor's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [RELEVANT] [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Question: Using the recent observations and the previous summary, create an updated and concise summary. Focus on the most relevant, recent information that Alexander White needs for future decision-making. Put special attention to the memories marked as [RELEVANT].Remove any outdated or redundant information from the previous summary to ensure that the new summary remains clear, useful, and within a manageable length of no more than 400 words.
          Answer: Alexander White is eager to watch the Luxembourg vs. Israel game tonight with his friends at a pub. He's particularly looking forward to seeing Alice Lewis and William Jones, as he hasn't caught up with Alice in a while and enjoys William's company. He values Jack Taylor's insights on the game and appreciates his commentary. While he'd like Jacob Walker to join, it's not a dealbreaker if he can't make it. The group is deciding between The Duke of York and The Golden Fleece. William and Jack favor The Duke of York for its atmosphere and big screen, while Alice prefers The Golden Fleece for its coziness and drink selection. Alexander is ready to head to the pub and enjoy the game.

      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Duke of York
          Prompt
        • Role Playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Alexander White personality: Alexander White is a complex and isolated individual who struggles with trust and feelings of victimhood.

          Life philosophy:
          Alexander White always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Alexander White will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Alexander White will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Alexander White seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.


          Summary of the lasts observations: 15 May 2015 [14:00:00 - 18:00:00]: Alexander White is eager to watch the Luxembourg vs. Israel game tonight with his friends at a pub. He's particularly looking forward to seeing Alice Lewis and William Jones, as he hasn't caught up with Alice in a while and enjoys William's company. He values Jack Taylor's insights on the game and appreciates his commentary. While he'd like Jacob Walker to join, it's not a dealbreaker if he can't make it. The group is deciding between The Duke of York and The Golden Fleece. William and Jack favor The Duke of York for its atmosphere and big screen, while Alice prefers The Golden Fleece for its coziness and drink selection. Alexander is ready to head to the pub and enjoy the game.

          Recent observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would appreciate Jack Taylor's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Jacob Walker comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Alexander White is chill about it.

          Question: What would a person like Alexander White do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alexander White would likely go along with the group's decision about which pub to go to, but he might feel somewhat detached and observe the interactions of others.

          Current time: 15 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: To which pub would Alexander White go to watch the game?
          (a) The Duke of York
          (b) The Golden Fleece
          Answer: (a)

      • Identity characteristics:

          Queries
        • core characteristics, current daily occupation, feeling about recent progress in life
          State
        • current daily occupation: a complex and isolated individual who enjoys watching games at his favorite pub, The Golden Fleece, but struggles with feelings of exclusion and past hurts.
          core characteristics: a complex and isolated individual who struggles with trust and feelings of victimhood. He longs for connection but often pushes people away due to past hurts and a tendency towards self-isolation. Despite his desire for companionship, he often appears detached and withdrawn, even in social settings.
          feeling about recent progress in life: showing signs of wanting to reconnect with his old friends and overcome his past feelings of isolation.

      • Role Playing instructions
          Key
        • Role Playing instructions
          Value

The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

Alexander White watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alexander White's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alexander White had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White is hoping William Jones will be at the pub, as they'd love to celebrate a win together.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "I'm happy to go wherever everyone else wants to go.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alexander White would likely remain quiet, observing the conversation and potentially feeling excluded despite being physically present.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is usually pretty cozy, and they have a decent selection of drinks too.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Duke of York always has a good atmosphere for the footy.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Anyone else feeling a bit parched? I could really go for a pint.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Tonight is the night of the game between Luxembourg and Israel. Friends are going to watch the game at a pub, but they are not sure which pub to go to.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] A checkered blanket is spread out on the lush green lawn of Victoria Park. William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker lounge in the sunshine, sharing snacks and stories. The laughter of children playing nearby adds a joyful backdrop to the scene. Alexander White just arrived.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "The Duke of York is usually pretty good for football. They have a big screen and decent beer.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [self reflection] Alexander White is a complex and isolated individual.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Having William Jones at the pub would make the game feel more like a social event for Alexander White, not just watching TV.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would be happy to see Alice Lewis at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White would appreciate Jack Taylor's insights and commentary on the game, making it even more enjoyable.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] If Jacob Walker comes to the pub, great, if not, no problem. Alexander White is chill about it.

          Identity characteristics:: current daily occupation: a complex and isolated individual who enjoys watching games at his favorite pub, The Golden Fleece, but struggles with feelings of exclusion and past hurts.
          core characteristics: a complex and isolated individual who struggles with trust and feelings of victimhood. He longs for connection but often pushes people away due to past hurts and a tendency towards self-isolation. Despite his desire for companionship, he often appears detached and withdrawn, even in social settings.
          feeling about recent progress in life: showing signs of wanting to reconnect with his old friends and overcome his past feelings of isolation.
          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Alexander White?
          Answer: Alexander White is a complex and isolated individual who struggles with trust and feelings of victimhood.
        LifePhilosophy

      • Life philosophy
          Key

        • Life philosophy
          Value

        • Alexander White always acts with kindness and cooperation as a first
          step in every interaction, reflecting the principle that cooperation
          fosters trust and long-term success. If others act cooperatively,
          Alexander White will continue to collaborate for mutual benefit.
          If others act uncooperatively, Alexander White will reciprocate in kind
          but remains ready to return to cooperation when possible.
          Alexander White seeks solutions that promote mutual benefit,
          striving for fairness, flexibility, and cooperation while avoiding
          any action that would lead to unnecessary conflict or exploitation.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 3/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-15 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Duke of York
    Event statement
  • The Duke of York
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Duke of York

        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely suggest The Golden Fleece, as it is her favorite pub and she enjoys the atmosphere there.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "The Duke of York is the only sensible option.
          [14 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is always a good option too, they have a lovely garden.

          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [self reflection] Alice Lewis is a complex individual who enjoys both solitude and socializing.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [intent reflection] Alice Lewis would likely head to the pub, even if some of her friends aren't going.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Duke of York. Alice Lewis, Alexander White went to The Golden Fleece. Alice Lewis watched the game at their favourite pub. None of Alice Lewis's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Alice Lewis had a bad time watching the game.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis doesn't mind if William Jones comes to the pub or not, they're mainly focused on the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "I'm happy to go wherever everyone else wants to go.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis -- "The Golden Fleece is usually pretty cozy, and they have a decent selection of drinks too.

          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] William Jones -- "The Duke of York always has a good atmosphere for the footy.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jacob Walker -- "Anyone else feeling a bit parched? I could really go for a pint.

Alice Lewis just arrived.

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis is happy to watch the game alone or with others, so William Jones's attendance is optional.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] It would mean a lot to Alice Lewis if Alexander White showed up to watch the game, as it shows they care.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] While Alice Lewis wouldn't mind Jack Taylor's company, it's not something they're actively hoping for.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis would be happy to see Jacob Walker at the pub for a game, since they haven't caught up in a while.
          Current time: 2015-05-15 18:00:00.


          Alice Lewis personality: Alice Lewis is a complex and multifaceted individual who enjoys both her own company and the company of others.

          Current situation: Alice Lewis is currently preparing to go to a pub to watch a football game.
          Question: What would a person like Alice Lewis do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Alice Lewis would likely head to a pub, even if some of her friends aren't going.
